meanings.definition: A person who plays defense in ice hockey.
meanings.sent1: The blueliners protect their goal from the opposing team.
meanings.sent2: The blueliners are crucial for stopping the other team from scoring.
meanings.sent3: Why did the blueliners bring a net to the game? To catch any stray pucks!
meanings.sent4: The blueliners stand like a wall, blocking any attempts to score.
meanings.sent5: The blueliners are like the shield of the team, guarding their territory.

meanings.definition: The defensive players on a hockey team.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the blueliners focus on protecting their side of the rink.
meanings.sent2: The blueliners work together to keep the puck away from their goal.
meanings.sent3: Why did the blueliners wear sunglasses during the game? To block the opponent's shots!
meanings.sent4: The blueliners move swiftly, intercepting any passes from the other team.
meanings.sent5: The blueliners are like the silent guardians of the ice, always watchful and ready to defend.
